thread.title: ALCS Game 6: Royals top Jays, reach second straight World Series - MLB
thread.title_full: ALCS Game 6: Royals top Jays, reach second straight World Series - MLB - SI.com

title: ALCS Game 6: Royals top Jays, reach second straight World Series - MLB
text:
by Jay Jaffe Twitter Email Posted: Sat Oct. 24, 2015
Kansas City — A season after a thrilling and improbable October run left the Royals 90 feet from tying Game 7 of the World Series in the bottom of the ninth inning—the result of third base coach Mike Jirschele throwing the brakes on Alex Gordon instead of risking a play at the plate—they’ll get another chance. Jirschele’s alert decision to send Lorenzo Cain home from first base on Eric Hosmer ’s long single into the rightfield corner in the bottom of the eighth inning paid off, providing the difference maker in the Royals’ pennant-clinching 4–3 win over the Blue Jays in Game 6 of the ALCS.
“I’ve been seeing it this whole series with [Blue Jays rightfielder Jose] Bautista, on a ball hit like that, he’s not really paying attention to the runner coming into third, he just comes up and throws the ball into second—firm to second,” said Jirschele. “I knew if we had speed coming into third base that we could go ahead and take a chance.”
MLB Video Royals top Blue Jays in ALCS Game 6 to reach second straight World Series by Cliff Corcoran
